alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Howell; Ozark; Shannon; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 30 at 1:03PM CDT until March 30 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR HOWELL, NORTHWESTERN SHANNON, SOUTHERN TEXAS, EASTERN DOUGLAS AND OZARK COUNTIES... At 103 PM CDT, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain causing flooding across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring across southern Ozark County. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... West Plains, Mountain View, Willow Springs, Houston, Cabool, Gainesville, Summersville and Raymondville. This includes the following low water crossings... Lick Creek at County Road 528, North Fork River at County Road 278, Spring Creek at County Road 349, Big Creek at County Road 390 and South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
